channel.title: Projects on Moo! - Michiel van der Meer
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Moo! - Michiel van der Meer

item.title: Axies
item.description: Below you will find all the values relevant in this experiment. Please use it as a reference if you want to find out more about the values you encounter. In a large bold font, you find the value ID and name. Listed underneath are all keywords associated with this value. Finally, we give a defining goal to each value. 0 - nuclear family couch, wedding, parents, sister, birth, family members, foundation, social education, unnatural, child, relatives.

item.title: Global Game Jam 2020
item.description: During the 2020 Global Game Jam, my team and I worked on Re-Pair, a retro RTS in Pico-8. The goal of the game is to pair up units into bigger ones, and defeat the evil forces. Your territory grows by scouting with small units, so don’t pair them all! You can play it below. Since it requires a mouse to be played, play it in your browser! var canvas = document.

item.title: RaLLy
item.description: I experimented with creating an OpenAI gym environment for the Rocket League Bot project. I forked the RLBot repo here, the gym environment can be found here and the DDPG implementation of a bot is on here.

item.title: Master thesis
item.description: I’m currently working on my master thesis in Reinforcement Learning on the topics of exploration strategies, compositionality and hierarchical models. My fork of ILLC’s machine can be found here. In addition, I push my utility files to an extra repo: turbo-goggles.

item.title: launch_ext
item.description: I made an space launch tracker extension for Google Chrome using LaunchLibrary!

item.title: Dotfiles
item.description: My laptop runs i3 on Ubuntu, so I’ve started a repo for keeping track of my window manager configuration.

item.title: Dutch Nao Team
item.description: I have been a part of the Dutch Nao Team since 2015, participating in the RoboCup Standard Platform League. I’ve been on multiple trips with my team, which has led me to quite a lot of different places: Techfest IIT, Mumbai, India (2015-2016) RoboCup European Open, Eindhoven, Netherlands (2016) RoboCup Leipzig, Germany (2016) RoHOW, Hamburg, Germany (2016) RoboCup Iran Open, Teheran, Iran (2017) RoboCup Nagoya, Japan (2017) RoHOW, Hamburg, Germany (2017) RoboCup Montreal, Canada (2018) Messe Dornbirn, Austria (2018) RoHOW, Hamburg, Germany (2018) Inside the team I was involved with the creation of our own framework, as well as leading the project group on automation.

item.title: ShareLatex scraper
item.description: I made a ShareLatex scraper, to download all my projects’ source files for a local backup.

item.title: language-netlogo
item.description: I created the NetLogo language package for Atom!
